intro: Elatostema medogense, commonly known as the Medog elatostema, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with cool climates. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and greenish-white in color. Elatostema medogense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
